title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that cover various aspects of event-centric Natural Language Processing (NLP
note: including methods for event representation, extraction, and prediction:

title: **Event Representation and Extraction:**

container-title: Proceedings of the Workshop on Annotating and Reasoning about Time and Events

container-title: Proceedings of the 48th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

container-title: Proceedings of the 51st Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

container-title: Proceedings of the 53rd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

container-title: Proceedings of the 53rd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Jointly extracting event triggers and arguments by dependency-bridge RNN and tensor-based argument interaction
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: Entity, relation, and event extraction with contextualized span representations
container-title: Proceedings of the 2019 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: A joint neural model for information extraction with global features
container-title: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

container-title: Proceedings of the 21st International Conference on World Wide Web

title: Learning statistical scripts with LSTM recurrent neural networks
container-title: Proceedings of the 30th AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: What happens next? Event prediction using a compositional neural network model
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The demographics of web search

title: Variational neural discourse relation recognizer
container-title: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

container-title: Proceedings of the 43rd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: These articles provide a broad and comprehensive overview of the field of event-centric NLP, covering various methodologies and advancements in event representation, extraction, and prediction
